intro: Van-tieghemia meridensis, commonly known as the mountain poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cooler, temperate climates. Its unique morphology includes a short stem with clustered leaves and a compact inflorescence. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
